comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Based in Halifax, Nova Scotia, the Mackay-Bennett was owned by the Commercial Cable Company, and was the first of four ships hired by the White Star Line to recover bodies of the victims of the Titanic disaster. The Captain was Frederick Harold Larnder. Some grim details here.

comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: Another link showing photos of the recovery operation: www.euronet.nl/users/keesree/dead.htm

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This photograph is part of the Indicommons.org post April 15, 1912: The Titanic.

comment.author: 77057821@N04
comment._content: My husbands grand uncle died on the MacKay-Bennett in Sept. 1915. Does anyone have any history on the ship at that time. This of course was afew yrs. after this ship was used to retrieve the bodies from the Titanic. The documents we have list F.H. Larnder as the master of the vessel at that time. Shipping Master Howard Bligh shipped his personal effects to his home with the sum of $25.30 for his wages. He worked less than a month when he died at the age of 26 yrs.

comment.author: 79007091@N05
comment._content: My great grandfather was an engineer at that time. I'd love to get a list of the names in that photo.

comment.author: 21750950@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77057821@N04] Might I sujest you look on Ancestry.Com for some of your answers our family The Bennetts' were some of the owners and builders of that time.My sister and I are in our 60's and realy just discovering our true history,My mother often spoke of our family haveing ship builders ect but not to the extent.I honistly just found out last night watching a history show about the Macky Bennett/also look up the Bennets of Keniston.There may be more info there.
